prompts.value: Do you prefer short, medium, or long rides?
Do you want to to ride easy, moderate, or fast?

speech: Great!  You can join our $ridelength ride group, they go at a $ridepace pace.  You can meet them on Saturdays at 9am.  Do you want to make appointment to rent a bike or do you want to buy a bike?  If neither, read the nutrition info below and have a nice ride!  If you are interested in our nutrition offering, say nutrition.
Tip for short rides (1 hour or less): Focus just on fluid replenishment ‌
Tip for short rides (1 hour or less): For optimal recovery, eat a full meal within an hour of finishing an intense workout.
Tip for short rides (1 hour or less):  Most people start with enough stored energy for a 60-minute workout, but carry a banana just in case you’re out longer than expected or you start to fade.
Tip for short rides (1 hour or less):  Be sure to carry plain water or a low-carb, electrolyte hydration drink
Tip for medium rides (1 to 3 hours):  Focus on carbohydrate replenishment‌
Tip for medium rides (1 to 3 hours): 2 bottles low-carb, electrolyte hydration drinks, at least
Tip for medium rides (1 to 3 hours): 30 to 60g of carb per hour from food.
Tip for medium rides (1 to 3 hours): Don’t wait until your hungry or thirsty to eat and drink. Take small nibbles and sips from the get-go.
Tip for medium rides (3 hours or more‌): Focus on carbohydrate and electrolyte replenishment; food boredom‌ or palette fatigue
Tip for long rides (3 hours or more‌): 2 bottles low-carb, electrolyte hydration drinks, at least‌

Tip for long rides (3 hours or more‌):  30 to 60g of carbs per hour, total. Digestion can get harder as rides get longer, so eat more solids at the beginning of the ride, and switch to blocks, chews, and other easily-digested foods during the final part of the ride. Just be sure to drink plenty of fluid to chase down gels, so you don’t get GI upset.

Tip for long rides (3 hours or more‌): Supplement bars and gels with carb-rich, low-protein, moderate-fat "real" foods. Don't worry about specific amounts of protein or fat; just eat what tastes good so you keep eating.
